intro: Stauracanthus boivinii f. escayracii, commonly known as the Escayracii form of the genus Stauracanthus, is a rare and specialized plant species. It belongs to the family Stauracanthaceae, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and specialized pollination mechanisms. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is adapted to specific ecological niches, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a relict species, offering insights into evolutionary adaptations in plant morphology and ecology.
